column4: how to reset root password via single user mode in ubuntu 10.04 lucid???help
theres no root password by default. if you set one, you can set it to a password via the passwd command
grub menus have a recovery/rescue mode i thought
yes you are right............but it also require password i think
you could also edit the grub line and replace 'quiet splash' with 'single' or '1' i think
i tend to rember my passwords. so i rarelyneed to reset them :)
clarify what you want to do exactly
i have 10.04 and want to upgrade to 11.04 or can format my laptop and install it,actually i dont have a good internet connection....so all my installed packages will be lost if i format my drive
i would suggest a clean install and you dont backup your package files to 11.04 you reinstall the ones you have installed.
you recommendedme clean install why so?is there problem in upgrading?
Yes, I need console-only, but it do not start
thers several in the repos, and many sites have  ppas for themes such as the webupd8 site. it has ppsa and some good guides and reviews of various themes
it really depends on exactly 'what' you are wantng to change the look of. the term 'themne' is a bit broad
